verse:
अन्यच्छ्रेयोऽन्यदुतैव प्रेयस्ते उभे नानार्थे पुरुषं सिनीतः।
तयोः श्रेय आददानस्य साधुभवति हीयतेऽर्थाद्य उ प्रेयो वृणीते ॥
meaning: Another (alternative) is indeed better, and another (pleasurable) is indeed pleasant. Both are different, well versed individuals choose the better of the two. The one who chooses the pleasant falls away from the goal.

upanishad-org.meaning: One thing is the good and quite another thing is the pleasant, and both seize upon a man with different meanings. Of these whoso takes the good, it is well with him; he falls from the aim of life who chooses the pleasant.
